Class IoManager

java.lang.Object
com.prototype.model.helpers.IoManager
public class IoManager extends Object
Utility class providing common validation methods for input data.

This class centralizes validation logic used across the application to ensure consistency and reduce code duplication. It performs checks for null values, empty fields, email format validation, and entity existence verification.

All methods are static, allowing them to be used without instantiating the class.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jorge Forero

  • Method Details

    • requireNotBlank

      public static void requireNotBlank(String fieldValue, String fieldName)
      Validates that a text value is neither null nor blank.
      Parameters:
      fieldValue - the value to validate
      fieldName - the name of the field used in error messages
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the value is null or blank

    • requireNotNull

      public static void requireNotNull(Object value, String fieldName)
      Validates that an object is not null.
      Parameters:
      value - the object to check
      fieldName - the name of the validated field
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the object is null

    • requireValidEmail

      public static void requireValidEmail(String email)
      Performs a basic validation of an email address.

      This method checks that the email is not blank and contains the characters @ and ., ensuring a minimal valid structure.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address to validate
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the email is null, blank, or does not match a basic format

    • requireExists

      public static void requireExists(Object entity, String fieldName, Object id)
      Validates that an entity exists in the database.

      This method is typically used after performing a lookup by ID.

      Parameters:
      entity - the entity returned from the database
      fieldName - the name of the field being validated
      id - the identifier used in the lookup
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the entity is null
